purpleculture_pinyin:
shǔ
to count; to count as; to regard as; to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
считать; считать как; рассматривать как; перечислить (недостатки сб)

shù
number; figure; several; Classifiers: 个
номер; фигура; несколько; Классификаторы: 个

shuò
frequently; repeatedly
часто; несколько раз
rtega_mnemonic:
數數RS
数数		number, several, count, fate
  • woman 女 taking 攵 an amount of rice 米 for the meal: she has to count so she doesn't use to much or else it will seal her family's fate
  • woman hanging 婁 a number of pearls around her neck. When she taps 攵 them they rattle.
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 数)
Pictophonetic: 婁 indicates the sound; 攵 (script) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
數落 [ shǔ luo ]: to enumerate sb's shortcomings; to criticize; to scold; to talk on and on
數不勝數 [ shǔ bù shèng shǔ ]: too many to count (idiom); innumerable
數量 [ shù liàng ]: amount; quantity; Classifiers: 个 ; quantitative
數字 [ shù zì ]: numeral; digit; number; figure; amount; digital (electronics etc); Classifiers: 个
數據 [ shù jù ]: data; numbers; digital
數見不鮮 [ shuò jiàn bù xiān ]: a common occurrence (idiom)

heisig_chinese_memo: The number one dream of the taskmaster is to be the captain of the flying dutchman (legendary ghost ship).
Ru_trainchinese:
shǔ: (глаг) считать, подсчитывать; считаться за; обвинять
shù: (сущ) (матем.) цифра, число; (грам.) число; судьба
shù: (число) несколько
shuò: (графема) (книжн.) неоднократно, много раз
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you're dragged (婁) and struck (攵) until you can count
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Young taskmaster is learning numbers by watching women haul sacks of rice past him. "One... two... four! No, wrong! Go back, go back!".
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of "攴" and " lou ", it means calculating and checking. "Shuwen": "Jiye. Congmiao, Lou Sheng." "Zhou Li‧Diguan‧Linren": "Use the number of nations above and below by age, and use the emperor and the valley to control the evil of the year. Feng." Zheng Xuan's note: "Counting is still counting."

" Number " is also included. The Northern Wei Dynasty Li Daoyuan's "Water Scriptures ‧ Lujiang Water": "Mount Lu is also the mountain of Pengze. Although it is not the number of the five mountains, it is a sacred mountain, and it is a very famous mountain."

" Number " also means the most prominent in comparison. Tang Dufu "Wei Shanlu Shizhaiguan Cao General Cao's Horse Drawing": "At the beginning of the country, I have come to paint a pommel horse, and he is the only king of Jiangdu.

" Number " also means inferior and inferior. Song Su Shi "Xie Ci Yu Shu Shi Biao": "The writing is not counted in You Xia, the book has been forced by King Zhong."

Blame can also be expressed as a " number ". "Twenty-eight years of Zuo Zhuan‧ Gong Xi": "The number of people does not need to be negative, and there are three hundred people who travel in the Xuan." Yang Bojun's note: "The "number of" is so obvious that you can count the crimes."

" Number " is also used for praise. "Xunzi·Wang Ba": "Not counted before the great gentleman."

" Number " is also used for discrimination. "Poetry‧Xiaoya‧Qiaoyan": "Communications and deeds, mind counts." Zhu Xi's collection: "Count, distinguish."

" Number " is also used to pronounce it to indicate number, arithmetic, method, reason, and order. Represents the number such as "Zuo Zhuan‧ Yingong Five Years": "The public asks the number of feathers in the public." Represents arithmetic such as "Zhou Li‧Diguan‧Da Situ": "Three Yue and Six Arts: Li, Music, Shooting, Yu, Book, number." The expression method is such as "Book of Shang Jun‧ Counting the Land": "So it is the number of the country, and the work is to cultivate grass." It means the truth is like "Han Feizi·Lonely Anger": "The husband fights for the letter of the close love with alienation. It’s countless.” Wang Xianshen’s collection of explanations: “number, reasoning.” The order of expression is like “Yi Zhou Shu‧ Da Ju”: “Resurrection and remission of humiliation, reduction of forgiveness, all in number.” Zhu Youzeng's proofreading: "Count, wait for the difference."

" Number " is also pronounced in the voice, which means repeated, "Sun Tzu‧ March": "Those who have repeatedly rewarded are embarrassed; those who have been punished are also embarrassed." It also means closeness, "Zuo Zhuan‧ Cheng Gong 16th Year": "No Days are not counted in the gate of Liuqing, and the talents of the country are all things.” Du's pre-note: “Count, not sparse.”
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " smooth " and " lou ", it means calculation and check.
humanum_full_description:
從「攴」，「婁」聲，表示計算、查點。《說文》：「計也。从攴，婁聲。」《周禮‧地官‧廩人》：「以歲之上下數邦用，以知足否，以詔穀用，以治年之凶豐。」鄭玄注：「數，猶計也。」

　　「數」也表示計算在內。北魏酈道元《水經注‧廬江水》：「廬山，彭澤之山也。雖非五嶽之數，穹隆嵯峨，實峻極之名山也。」

　　「數」還表示比較起來最突出。唐杜甫〈韋諷錄事宅觀曹將軍畫馬圖〉：「國初已來畫鞍馬，神妙獨數江都王。」

　　「數」亦表示次於、亞於。宋蘇軾〈謝賜御書詩表〉：「文不數於游夏，書已逼於鍾王。」

　　責備也可以「數」表示。《左傳‧僖公二十八年》：「數之以其不用僖負羈，而乘軒者三百人也。」楊伯峻注：「『數之』云云，數其罪也。」

　　「數」也用作稱道。《荀子‧王霸》：「不足數於大君子之前。」

　　「數」還用作分辨。《詩‧小雅‧巧言》：「往來行言，心焉數之。」朱熹集傳：「數，辨也。」

　　「數」還用去聲讀法，表示數目、算術、方法、道理、次序。表示數目如《左傳‧隱公五年》：「公問羽數於眾仲。」表示算術如《周禮‧地官‧大司徒》：「三曰六藝：禮、樂、射、御、書、數。」表示方法如《商君書‧算地》：「故為國之數，務在墾草。」表示道理如《韓非子‧孤憤》：「夫以疏遠與近愛信爭，其數不勝也。」王先慎集解：「數，理也。」表示次序如《逸周書‧大聚》：「復亡解辱，削赦輕重，皆有數。」朱右曾校釋：「數，等差也。」

　　「數」還有入聲讀法，表示屢次，《孫子‧行軍》：「屢賞者窘也；數罰者困也。」也表示親近，《左傳‧成公十六年》：「無日不數於六卿之門，國之材人無不事也。」 杜預注：「數，不疏。」
humanum_short_description: 從「攴」，「婁」聲，表示計算、查點。

数数 		number, several, count, fate
  • woman 女 taking 攵 an amount of rice 米 for the meal: she has to count so she doesn't use to much or else it will seal her family's fate
  • woman hanging 婁 a number of pearls around her neck. When she taps 攵 them they rattle.

  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 婁 [ lóu ] a constellation; to wear; surname
    • 攵 [ pū ] to rap, to tap; script; to let go
①一個一個地計算：不可勝數。數九。
②比較起來突出：數得着。
③責備，列舉過錯：數落。
④談論，述說：數說。數典忘祖(喻忘掉自己本來的情況，亦喻對於本國曆史的無知)。
數落 [ shǔ luo ]: to enumerate sb's shortcomings; to criticize; to scold; to talk on and on
數不勝數 [ shǔ bù shèng shǔ ]: too many to count (idiom); innumerable
①表示、劃分或計算出來的量：數目。數量。數詞。數論(數學的一支，主要研究正整數的性質以及和它有關的規律)。數控。
②幾，幾個：數人。數日。
③技藝，學術：“今夫弈之爲數，小數也”。
④命運，天命：天數。氣數。

數據 [ shù jù ]: data; numbers; digital
①屢次：數見不鮮(亦稱“屢見不鮮”)。
數見不鮮 [ shuò jiàn bù xiān ]: a common occurrence (idiom)

Chinese: The number one dream of the taskmaster is to be the captain of the flying dutchman (legendary ghost ship).
Meaning: number
Hanzi: 数
Story: Young taskmaster is learning numbers by watching women haul sacks of rice past him. "One... two... four! No, wrong! Go back, go back!".
Kind: traditional

從「 攴 」，「 婁 」聲，表示計算、查點。《說文》：「計也。从攴，婁聲。」《周禮‧地官‧廩人》：「以歲之上下數邦用，以知足否，以詔穀用，以治年之凶豐。」鄭玄注：「數，猶計也。」 「 數 」也表示計算在內。北魏酈道元《水經注‧廬江水》：「廬山，彭澤之山也。雖非五嶽之數，穹隆嵯峨，實峻極之名山也。」 「 數 」還表示比較起來最突出。唐杜甫〈韋諷錄事宅觀曹將軍畫馬圖〉：「國初已來畫鞍馬，神妙獨數江都王。」 「 數 」亦表示次於、亞於。宋蘇軾〈謝賜御書詩表〉：「文不數於游夏，書已逼於鍾王。」 責備也可以「 數 」表示。《左傳‧僖公二十八年》：「數之以其不用僖負羈，而乘軒者三百人也。」楊伯峻注：「『數之』云云，數其罪也。」 「 數 」也用作稱道。《荀子‧王霸》：「不足數於大君子之前。」 「 數 」還用作分辨。《詩‧小雅‧巧言》：「往來行言，心焉數之。」朱熹集傳：「數，辨也。」 「 數 」還用去聲讀法，表示數目、算術、方法、道理、次序。表示數目如《左傳‧隱公五年》：「公問羽數於眾仲。」表示算術如《周禮‧地官‧大司徒》：「三曰六藝：禮、樂、射、御、書、數。」表示方法如《商君書‧算地》：「故為國之數，務在墾草。」表示道理如《韓非子‧孤憤》：「夫以疏遠與近愛信爭，其數不勝也。」王先慎集解：「數，理也。」表示次序如《逸周書‧大聚》：「復亡解辱，削赦輕重，皆有數。」朱右曾校釋：「數，等差也。」 「 數 」還有入聲讀法，表示屢次，《孫子‧行軍》：「屢賞者窘也；數罰者困也。」也表示親近，《左傳‧成公十六年》：「無日不數於六卿之門，國之材人無不事也。」 杜預注：「數，不疏。」

數字的基本解释

數
shù

數
shǔ

數
shuò
均见“数”。

數字的汉语字典释义

[①]［shù］
［《廣韻》色句切，去遇，生。］
“数1”的繁体字。
(1)数目；數量。
(2)引申为年数、岁数。
(3)底细。
(4)犹几。表示不定的少数。
(5)算术，数学。古代六艺之一。
(6)表示事物的量的基本数学概念。
(7)一种语法范畴，表示名词或代词所指事物的数量。
(8)道数，方法。
(9)技艺；技巧。
(10)策略；权术。
(11)历数。
(12)特指方术，如占卜之类。
(13)规律；必然性。
(14)道理。
(15)天命；命运。
(16)法制。
(17)顺序；次序。
(18)引申为等级。
(19)礼数；仪节。
(20)指星象的度数。
[②]［shǔ］
［《廣韻》所矩切，上麌，生。］
“数2”的繁体字。
(1)计算；查点。
(2)算在数内。
(3)谓比较起来最突出。
(4)亚于；次于。
(5)数说，一件一件地说。
(6)数落；责备。
(7)称道。
(8)分辨；详察。

數字的康熙字典解释

【卯集下】【攴字部】　數； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页475第04
【廣韻】所矩切【集韻】爽主切，?音籔。【說文】計也。【易·說卦】數往者順。【詩·小雅】心焉數之。【禮·曲禮】問國君之富，數地以對。　又【博雅】責也。【左傳·昭二年】使吏數之。【註】責數其罪。　又【集韻】?阻切，音所。義同。　又【廣韻】色句切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】雙遇切，?音捒。算數也。【羣經音辨】計之有多少曰數。【類篇】枚也。【易·節卦】君子以制數度議德行。【疏】數度，謂尊?禮命之多少。又【繫辭】極數知來之謂占。【疏】蓍策之數。【書·大禹謨】天之曆數在汝躬。【疏】天之曆運之數。【周禮·天官·小宰】掌官常以治數。【註】治數，每事多少異也。【後漢·律曆志】隷首作數。【註】隷首，黃帝之臣。　又【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?色角切，音朔。頻數也。【禮·祭義】祭不欲數，數則煩。　又【爾雅·釋詁】數，疾也。【疏】皆謂急疾也。　又【集韻】蘇谷切，音速。【禮·樂記】衞音趨數煩志。【註】趨數，讀爲促速，聲之誤也。【史記·賈生傳】淹數之度兮，語余其期。【註】徐

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［shù］
["Guangyun" color sentence is cut, meet, and be born. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "数1".
(1) Number; quantity.
(2) Extended to the number of years and age.
(3) Bottom line.
(4) Judith. Represents an uncertain minority.
(5) Arithmetic, mathematics. One of the six ancient arts.
(6) The basic mathematical concepts that express the quantity of things.
(7) A grammatical category that expresses the number of things referred to by nouns or pronouns.
(8) Number of channels and methods.
(9) Skills; skills.
(10) Strategy; power manipulation.
(11) Calendar numbers.
(12) Specifically refers to alchemy, such as divination.
(13) Law; Inevitability.
(14) Reason.
(15) Destiny; Destiny.
(16) Legal system.
(17) Order; order.
(18) Extended to rank.
(19) Etiquette; ritual festival.
(20) Refers to the degree of astrology.
[②] [shǔ]
[From "Guangyun" cut, the upper head, and the raw. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "数2".
(1) Calculation; check points.
(2) Count in the number.
(3) It is the most prominent in comparison.
(4) Inferior to; inferior to.
(5) Count, say one by one.
(6) Scolding; blame.
(7) Praise.
(8) Distinguish; observe carefully.
